ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 58
ygData.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/16/99 7:26:54 AM Central Daylight Time, EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com writes:
ygData.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/16/99 7:26:54 AM Central Daylight Time,
EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com writes:

<< Just want to say, when we are finally able to make plate (this isn't in
the near future, mind you. Tailoring is probably next to be worked on
after make poison, and then probably tinkering or alchemy from what I've
read all around), we should only sell for 5 to 10 plat less than the
magical plates are sold for. We can't sell for NPC plate prices (people
would just buy magical plate) but I really don't want to shoot myself in
the foot and have the same thing happen with plate as it did to banded.
Please, no flames, I know some of you will only want 10 plat profit per
piece, that's your right, and this is mine. This is what I will be doing
and I would hope if you're concerned over smithing, please do the same.
Plate will NOT be cheaper to make oneself (not only the 150 plat it
takes to get to banded, but all the time selling banded to get to making
plate), so we don't have to worry about that happening. Just gotta be
competitive with magical plates. Again, please no flames, I'm terribly
sick of them, and I will not respond. Please, if you're on my side,
don't respond to any flames either. Let the baby have his/her bottle.
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM >>

We are going to have serious problems with selling plate on mature servers.
As you said, it will be a long time till they implement plate into the game.
Already, very very few people buy store plate. Most people move from banded,
to bronze, to magic. I only see a market for steel if it is significantly
cheaper than magic and only slightly more expensive than bronze. (This
assumption is based on plate being exactly the same as store plate) If plate
was available from PC's from the beginning, then we would have a thriving
market. Since deflation has already set in on most, if not all, mature
servers, it will be hard to start selling a high priced median item for much
of a profit (at least as much as it will take to get good at it). We should
all pray to the EQ ghods for item decay ;-)

Hawkwin of Hawkwin's Roaming Emporium
